Package io.github.ulalax.zmq.core

Class ZmqException

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Throwable
java.lang.Exception
java.lang.RuntimeException
io.github.ulalax.zmq.core.ZmqException
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class ZmqException extends RuntimeException
Exception thrown when a ZeroMQ operation fails.

This exception wraps error information from libzmq, including the error number (errno) and a descriptive error message. It extends RuntimeException so it does not need to be explicitly caught.

Usage Example:


 try {
     int rc = LibZmq.bind(socket, "tcp://*:5555");
     ZmqException.throwIfError(rc);
 } catch (ZmqException e) {
     if (e.isAgain()) {
         // Would block, retry later
     } else if (e.isTerminated()) {
         // Context was terminated
     } else {
         System.err.println("Error: " + e.getMessage());
     }
 }

Common Error Types:

  • isAgain() - Operation would block (EAGAIN)
  • isTerminated() - Context was terminated (ETERM)
  • isInterrupted() - Operation was interrupted (EINTR)
Since:
1.0.0
